title: Impossible Keen 3 area?
content: I have a question about the mountain level of CK3 before Mort's level. I have tried many times to reach the exit that is underground after the doors, but there's no way to reach the doors. I only can finish the level by "going up" as the sign at the beginning says. Is that a bug? Or is it really and unreachable area?

title: hehe
content: Because the level was probably not playtested very well, it is impossible to reach the exit within the mountain. Just translate and go around.

title: Re: hehe
content:
It could be made just for annoyment, hence the sign.. People that don't translate it keep adventuring the depths of the mountain, desperately trying to find their way out, and finally finding out (maybe) that it isn't even possible to finish other way than climbing over it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] Or then it's just a bug, as there are some other unaccessible areas in Keen 3.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: hehe
content:
The fact that the levels were created over a week-end probably settles it as the fact that proper beta testing wasn't really done so you can't get there.

There's also this big house level with numerous of rooms, and if I recall correctly around ~70% of the level couldn't actually be accessed.

title: Re: hehe
content:
Yeah, quite right -- both facts true. I wish they had paid more attention to Keen 3 levels. That's another reason why I don't play Keen 3 that much, it's because of the (often) bad level work. It can't be compared to the other episodes at all.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

It's really a shame, though, since Keen3 had the most versatile and interesting set of enemies in the entire Keen series. 3 jumping enemy types, working elevators, two projectile users, and the feet/arms. So much more interesting than Keen4...

title: Re: ...
content:
Well, at least that means it has good mod potential.
I agree though, it's a shame about the actual game.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Keen 3 second-to-last level
content: I beg to differ. I have finished the level many times. It is hard, but it is by no means impossible.

title: Lies!!
content: I beg to differ with your differing, dude. [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/maps/maps-k3-lvl15.html]Here's a map of the level in question[/url]... scroll down to the bottom, and head right, slowly. There's a passageway only 1 tile tall, and Keen is 2 tiles tall. How do you get past?

title: Re: Lies!!
content: I can see only two areas there with a passageway one tile tall - and both those places have alternate entrances - am I missing something?

title: Re: Lies!!
content:
The impossible segment in question:

[img]http://i16.photobucket.com/albums/b33/freeyorp101/impossiblelevel.jpg[/img]

There is no way to get past this; in order to leave alive, keen must either exit via the top door, or modify the level.

[hr]

---Freeyorp

title: Seil!
content: Not to mention if it was possible to get past that point, after getting through all the doors you're faced with impassable spikes jutting from the roof and floor.

title: Re: Lies!!
content: Oh that's odd, when I looked at that the other day I could've sworn I saw another way around that point - my mistake [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

title: Re: Lies!!
content:
Maybe the author of this level thought they were goin to add destructible tiles to the Keen engine (like Crystal Caves or Duke Nukum). That support was never added and the author of the level forgot to remove what was supposed to be a placeholder for a destructible tile. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: Lies!!
content:
That's thinking too far. Probably just a mistake. Try making a maze with your mouse in a zoomed-in MS Paint real quick. You're bound to make at least one 'blocked path' mistake.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Keen 3 second-to-last level
content: Oops...I was thinking of a different level.  When I got home, I checked out the level and was pretty embarrassed to realize it was the wrong one.  [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shikadi.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen 3 second-to-last level
content: I had always noticed that about the mountain level.  Fortunately, I have never had the patience to try and navigate those monotonous caves anyway, and since the 4-door exit is inaccessible, I always just go over.

title: Re: Keen 3 second-to-last level
content:
Hal's Kitchen is by no means 70% inacessable, the area is more like 40-50%

Both annoyed the tush off me for years though, as I assumed the game makers knew what they were doing and I didn't.[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Awww! Feel the love!
